thread.title: Community's Donald Glover is heading back to TV for the hip-hop comedy series Atlanta - US TV
thread.title_full: Community's Donald Glover is heading back to TV for the hip-hop comedy series Atlanta - US TV News - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Community's Donald Glover is heading back to TV for the hip-hop comedy series Atlanta - US TV
text: Community's Donald Glover is heading back to TV for his own music comedy series.FX has ordered a full season of Atlanta, which has been in development dating back to 2013. Â© Getty Images / Lester Cohen/WireImage Atlanta will dramatise the city's burgeoning hip-hop scene through the eyes of cousins played by Glover and Brian Tyree Henry (The Book of Mormon), with Lakeith Lee Stanfield and Zazie Beetz in supporting roles."Atlanta draws on Donald's considerable talents as a musician, actor and writer to give us something unique," FX's co-president Nick Grad said today (October 15)."The story is made all the more powerful by the great cast and the contributions of Donald's fellow executive producer Paul Simms and director Hiro Murai. "We can't wait to for the debut of Atlanta next year."Glover's departure from cult hit Community two years ago came as he began development on Atlanta.He has since also focused on his rap career as Childish Gambino, and this year lent his voice to China, IL and Ultimate Spider-Man.
